title: Remove the tokio-stream dependency.
body: This PR removes the tokio-stream dependency and replaces its use with futures-util.

title: Add a check for same-origin to uri::Https and rrdp::NotificationFile.
body: This PR adds a check for the same origin (i.e., authority part) to `uri::Https` and all URIs in the RRDP notification file.

title: Update MSRV to 1.64.
body:
This PR updates the reported minimal supported Rust version to 1.64.

This was already required since some code uses the `await` keyword. So it can probably be done safely without a breaking change.

title: Allow converting Serial to and from a byte array.
body:
This PR adds functions and trait implementations to convert `Serial` to and from a `[u8; 20]`.

Because serials are unsigned, the left-most bit must not be set which means conversion from an array can fail.

title: Upgrade to chrono 0.4.35.
body: This PR upgrade the dependency on chrono 0.4.35. This mostly means `chrono::Duration` is now `chrono::TimeDelta` (to distinguish it from std’s `Duration` type).  In order to avoid breaking changes, this PR does not rename `Validity::from_duration`.

title: Improve rtr client version negotiation.
body:
This PR improves (well, fixes) the protocol version negotiation of the RTR client.

Previously it just accepted whatever version the server proposed. Now it requests a pre-defined maximum version and rejects any response with a version greater than it.

title: Let RTR server not support v2 just yet.
body:
This PR limits the protocol version supported by the RTR server to 1 or less.

While we technically support version 2, the ASPA PDU format has not yet been agreed upon and may still change. So rather than have people deploy potentially broken servers, we disable the version.

title: Return expected version in the RTR server error PDU on mismatch.
body:
This PR changes the version reported by the RTR server in the header of the RTR error PDU when a request has an invalid version. It returns the maximum supported version if a version hasn’t been negotiated yet. It returns the negotiated version if the client uses a different version after negotiation.

This fixes [Routinator issue 919](https://github.com/NLnetLabs/routinator/issues/919).

title: Upgrade dependencies: ring and quick-xml.
body:
This PR upgrades the dependencies to new breaking versions. In particular, these are the _ring_ and _quick-xml_ crates.

Fixes #277.

This is a breaking change.

title: Correct RFC number
body:
- Correct RFC number (81821 -> 8182)
- Add links to IETF datatracker and Wikipedia for context

title: Upgrade bcder to 0.7.3.
body: This PR upgrades the _bcder_ dependency to at least 0.7.3. This avoids the decoding issues described in CVE-2023-39914.

title: Correctly reject non-version 1 ASPA objects.
body: This PR fixes an issue where the ASPA decoder would still allow version 0 objects.

title: Add `base64::Slurm::write_encoded_slice`.
body: This PR adds a `write_encoded_slice` method to `util::base64::Slurm`.

title: Add serialized repository objects for compatibility tests.
body:
This PR adds test objects generated by the current Serde implementation to the test-data and adds tests whether deserializing them succeeds. It also moves the files around a bit in the test-data directory.

This PR is in preparation of the Base 64 refactoring in #263.

title: Change ASPA object version to 1.
body: This PR changes the value of the version field of the ASPA object to 1.

title: Adjust ASPA to new drafts.
body:
This PR changes the ASPA implementation to the new versions of the Internet drafts.

It changes the ASPA object in the repository module to profile draft version 15. For RTR, it drops the address family attribute but sticks to the PDU format in the old draft and just always sets the AFI flags to zero.

Because the provider AS set is now essentially an encoded version of `SmallAsnSet`, the PR also adds a conversion from the former into the latter that omits the unnecessary checks.

The code now also enforces a non-empty provider AS set upon parsing.

title: Add a base64 utility module.
body:
This PR adds a new module `util::base64` which provides all the Base 64-related activities. It includes marker structs representing the various Base64 applications used in crate’s environment so you don’t have to remember the exact flavor and other conditions of Base 64 this application uses.

The module is public, so users of the crate can use it rather than depending on the _base64_ crate directly.

title: Drop dependency on routecore.
body:
This PR drops _routecore_ as a dependency and includes all the code from that crate we need for RPKI.

Having a shared dependency between the RPKI and BGP projects was a bit premature and the overlap is relatively small. Keeping things separate removes some administrative burden on the BGP projects during their early stages, so this seems the right move. We can always reconsider later.

The PR moves what used to be `routecore::{addr, asn}` to `crate::resources::asn` and`routecore::bgpsec::KeyIdentifier` to `crate::crypto::keys::KeyIdentifier` (where it was re-exported already previously).

title: Additional methods to check if SLURM filters drop payload.
body: This PR adds the drop check to SLURM’s router key filters and provides type specific check methods for both route origin and router key filters.

title: Make `rtr::server::NotifyReceiver` public.
body: This PR makes the RTR server notification receiver public so it can be used in other code as well.

title: Prepare for release 0.16.1.
body:
New

* Added implementations for the `arbitrary::Arbitrary` trait to ASN and IP resource types. ([#255])
* Added more strict checks to validation of ASPA objects in accordance with [draft-ietf-sidrops-aspa-profile12](https://datatracker.ietf.org/doc/draft-ietf-sidrops-aspa-profile/12/). ([#256])

Other changes

* Downgraded the minimum Rust version to 1.63. ([#257])

[#255]: https://github.com/NLnetLabs/rpki-rs/pull/255
[#256]: https://github.com/NLnetLabs/rpki-rs/pull/256
[#257]: https://github.com/NLnetLabs/rpki-rs/pull/257

title: Only require Rust 1.63.
body: This PR switches to routecore release 0.3.1 so we only require Rust 1.63.

title: Additional checks for ASPA validation.
body:
This PR adds three more checks to validation of ASPA objects included in [draft-ietf-sidrops-aspa-profile12](https://datatracker.ietf.org/doc/draft-ietf-sidrops-aspa-profile/12/).

Specifically, it now

* checks that that the customer AS does not appear in the provider AS set,
* AS resources of the certificate were not of the "inherit" variant, and
* IP resources are absent.

title: Implement `Arbitrary` for RTR payload types.
body:
This PR adds implementations of the _arbitrary_ crate’s `Arbitrary` trait to some of the RTR payload types. This is necessary to support fuzzing.

The dependency on _arbitrary_ and consequently the impls are optional.

title: Csr ca repo trailing slash
body:
This PR enforces a trailing slash for CSRs at two levels. First it ensures that the `ca_repository` ends with a trailing slash. Secondly, it will now inject a trailing slash even if it is missing the ca_repository URI that is submitted when a CSR is created.

The latter may be overkill. Perhaps it should actually return an error instead if the trailing slash is missing, rather than apply a magic fix. But there is currently no convenient way to return a specific error for this.

title: Various improvements and changes to support ASPA in the RTR server.
body:
This PR includes a number of improvements and changes, some breaking, to support ASPA in the RTR server.

Most importantly, it introduces a new dedicated type for references to any type of RTR payload, `PayloadRef`, rather than using `&Payload`, so a reference can be generated from a reference to a distinct payload type. The server traits now use this new type to refer to payload.

This is a breaking change.

title: Don’t panic on long provider AS sets
body: This PR changes the previously introduced `rtr::pdu::ProviderAsns::from_iter` type to error out if it is given too many ASNs rather than panicking and renames it to `try_from_iter` to avoid distressing Clippy.

title: Support ASPA payload in RTR.
body:
This PR adds support for protocol version 2 of RTR. This introduces a new PDU type for ASPA payload.

This PR also fixes a bug in the RTR server code that included router key PDUs in the updates even if protocol version 0 was negotiated. (The client code accepts all PDU types in all versions.)

The PR also changes the methods and functions in the `rtr::pdu` module to use the type `Asn` instead of `u32` for ASNs.

 This is a breaking change.

title: Expose `Roa` and `Aspa` inner content
body: There is currently no obvious way to consume the content of a `Roa` or a `Aspa` object. This PR adds  a `content(&self)` function to return a reference the the inner content for `Roa` and `Aspa` structs.

title: Id cert basic ca path len
body: This caused an interop issue because it's not explicitly forbidden to use this in the context of RFC 6492, 8181 and 8183. Even if this is not normally expected in RPKI resource certificates.

title: RTR server: Report the right type of query in Socket::update.
body: Currently, the server always sets `reset` to `true`.

title: Allow, and ignore, CRL extensions for RFFC 6492 and RFC 8181.
Imclude all resource_set_* types in Resource Class List Response
Accept missing trailing slash in RFC 8183 XML namespaces.
Fix conditional attributes for features.
body: Some conditional attributes where missing resulting in errors and warnings for certain combinations of features. This PR fixes that.

title: Allow creating certificate resources covering all addresses and ASNs.
body: This PR adds an associated function `all` to `IpBlocks` and `AsBlocks` and a couple more types to create values that cover all possible resources.

title: Always create a new block when building a resource chain.
body: This fixes an issue where IP ranges that were also IP prefixes were not converted into prefixes as required by RFC 3779.

title: XML encoder: remove erroneous initial line break
body:
The PR fixes the erroneous initial line feed inserted before the root element.

This PR also removes the inline feature of the XML encoder which wasn’t exposed in the public API and proved to complicated to wrap my head around.
